name: PlotGlobalSensitivity
description:
Calculates and plots the global sensitivity of a given target (performance attribute) w.r.t. a batch of data samples. 
Requires a dataset and a trained model to be loaded. 
Global sensitivity can be slow to compute for large datasets, so it is recommended to subsample using `n_samples`.

inputParameters.name: target_name
inputParameters.description: Name of a target performance attribute.

inputParameters.name: set_name
inputParameters.description: Name of the dataset-subset to be used ('train', 'val' or 'test'). Dafault: 'val'.

inputParameters.name: n_samples
inputParameters.description: Number of samples to be drawn from the selected dataset-subset. Optional. If not provided, all samples from the selected dataset-subset are used.

inputParameters.name: plot
inputParameters.description: Set to True to calculate and plot the local sensitivity.
